lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

* A duke.exception.DukeException is thrown if there is any error related to duke.Duke the chatbot.
* @param message the message to be printed when a duke.exception.DukeException is thrown and caught.
* A duke.exception.DukeInvalidDeletionException is thrown if the user tries to delete a task that doesn't exist, or if the user
* tries to perform a deletion on an empty task list.
* @param message the message to be printed when a duke.exception.DukeInvalidDeletionException is thrown and caught.
* A duke.exception.DukeInvalidDescriptionException is thrown if the user tries to add a task without giving it either a name or
* description, or if no due date or time is given for Events and Deadlines.
* @param message the message to be printed when a duke.exception.DukeInvalidDescriptionException is thrown and caught.
* A duke.exception.DukeInvalidInputException is thrown if the user gives an unknown input/command.
* Public constructor for a duke.exception.DukeInvalidInputException which will print the standardized message when thrown and
super(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means D:");
* A duke.exception.DukeMarkException is thrown if the user tries to mark an already marked task, or if they try to un-mark a task
* @param message the message to be printed when a duke.exception.DukeMarkException is thrown and caught.
